history.content:
Concurrent enrollment students will not appear on the waitlist. 

However, you have a good chance to get enrolled based on the enrollment statistics from the past few years(You can find them on www.berkeleytime.com).

That is correct. The wait list only shows FT UCB students. Concurrent enrollments are considered APPLICATIONS that fall outside the regular enrollment system. We cannot approve you until there is NO ONE on the wait list for a class. This is why I do not process concurrent enrollment applications until very near the add/drop deadline when I know which classes have no wait list.

Sorry this is not better news, CompSci classes are very impacted and often we cannot even accommodate everyone on the wait list. As the student says above, this class has approved concurrent enrollment applications in the past but that is no guarantee that it will happen this semester.

Hi

I am a concurrent enrollment student and have applied for cs 61b.

In the classes.berkeley.edu I could find that it has 92 students for the wait list.

I wonder whether all 92 students are full time berkeley students or it includes other students too.

I think if it is all full time berkeley students, I have a high possibility of not being able to be enrolled.

Thank you!
history.subject: 61B enrollment
